case_vignette: A 65-year-old man comes to the emergency department 1 hour after a loss of consciousness. His wife said he suddenly fainted while she was adjusting his necktie. He regained consciousness within 30 seconds and was fully alert and oriented. He has had two similar episodes in the last year. He has anxiety and takes alprazolam as needed. He smokes half a pack of cigarettes daily and drinks two glasses of wine with dinner each night. His temperature is 37.2°C (98.9°F), pulse is 70/min and regular, respirations are 13/min, blood pressure is 130/82 mm Hg when supine and 122/80 mm Hg while standing. Cardiopulmonary examination shows no abnormalities. Neurologic examination shows no focal findings. A complete blood count shows no abnormalities. Bedside cardiac monitoring shows infrequent premature ventricular contractions and QRS voltage below 5 mm in leads II and III.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly fainted an hour ago.
How old are you?
I'm 65 years old.
Do you have a history of heart disease or high blood pressure?
No, my heart and blood pressure have been fine according to recent check-ups.
Do you experience any chest pain or discomfort?
No, I don't have any chest pain or discomfort.
Do you take any medications regularly? If so, what are they?
I only take alprazolam as needed for anxiety.
Do you have a family history of heart disease?
I don't know, you didn't ask about my family history before.
I apologize for that oversight. Could you provide any information about your family's medical history?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
**Final Diagnosis:** Vasovagal Syncope
